_exec_summary.SummaryText:
CAA 112(r) Executive Summary

MTM Resources 2 LLC dba Idaho Specialty Storage & Distribution
Idaho Specialty Storage & Distribution (ISS&D) is a newly formed company (first date of operation 9/1/10) focused in warehousing of chemicals, specifically packaged goods.  This summary describes ISS&DA?s Risk Management Program for the facilities located at 1336 N 20th Street, Nampa, ID  83687.

Statement of Management Commitment to Safety
ISS&DA?s President has drafted the following Statement on Safety and the Environmental Responsibility of the Company.  The below statement is posted on the Company bulletin board for employees, customers, and regulatory agencies evidencing our commitment. 

A?The safety of employees and the community stake holders is paramount to our existence.  It is the responsibility of every employee to ensure that we warehouse chemicals in a responsible manner while providing outstanding service to our customers.A?

ISS&D not only has taken steps to ensure that the chemicals we warehouse are stored responsibility, but we have also put in place monitoring and handling systems to ensure proper security and safety procedures.   

Facility Description
ISS&D is located at the end of N 20th Street (i.e. the last business on the street which ends in a cul-de-sac) on land parcel of three acres with NO adjacent schools, residential neighbors, wildlife refuges, parks, or other recreational centers.  There is no through traffic on this street and only traffic destined for the ISS&D facility would have purpose for this destination other than city or county employees such as land surveyors.  The general area is industrial businesses.  ISS&D is directly bordered by I-84 to the North, vacant land to the East, West, and South.

Description of Primary Activities at ISS&D
For the RMP chemical regulated products, ISS&D is a warehousing facility only.  The Company does not manufacture or fill containers.  ISS&D only receives, stores, and ships containers for a select cu

stomer base.  The RMP chemical regulated products handled are Sulfur Dioxide in 150 lb cylinders and Chlorine in 150 lb cylinder and 2,000 lb cylinders.  ISS&DA?s average quantities on hand at any given time are 80 x 150 lb Chlorine cylinders, 4 x 2,000 lb Chlorine cylinders, and 20 x 150 lb Sulfur Dioxide cylinders.

Description of Facility Processes
ISS&D engages in the following activities related to the RMP chemical regulated products:
Upon entrance to and exit from the ISS&D facility, all visitors must sign in on the Visitor Sign In Log per company SOP EHS-514.  Annually (calendar year), each visitor to the facility must read and sign the Visitor/Contractor Sign In Sheet detailing the safety and conduct standards to which each Visitor or Contractor must adhere. 
In cooperation with our customerA?s drivers, ISS&D receives the packaged products via truck and places them in a clearly marked and designated area for the specific products within the Gas Storage Building only.  The packages are secured properly with either E-Track or chocks depending on the container.  Upon customer pick up, ISS&D personnel in cooperation with our customerA?s drivers will load the products.  Whether loading or unloading, 150 lb cylinders are to be handled using a handcart manufactured for such containers.  Tonners are to be unloaded via forklift with a rating of not less than 5,000 lbs.

Facility Security & Safety
The ISS&D facility is secured in several ways.  First, the entire facility in surrounded by 6 ft high fencing with barbed wire strings on top.  The facility has one entry and one exit gate through which truck traffic flows.  The entry gate is open during business hours only and locked during non business hours.  The exit gate is closed and locked 24/7.  All buildings on the premises are alarmed and monitored by a third party company.

RMP chemical regulated products are only stored in the Compressed Gas Building.  This building is equipped with an alarm system which is activ

e 24 hours per day / 7 days per week and monitored by third company party for unauthorized access.  The alarm system is only deactivated to allow necessary business activities.  Upon completion of the necessary business activities, the alarm system is reactivated.  The Compressed Gas Building is also equipped with A?sniffersA? which have been installed within the facility to detect any gas releases.   Should any releases be detected by the monitoring equipment, the following activities will occur: (1) a physical alarm will sound  (2) the alarm system will send a signal to the third party monitoring company  (3) the scrubber system will activate and the internal air will be filtered through a scrubber solution until the levels of the detected release are abated.  The Compressed Gas Building is also equipped with a monitoring system for Fire by a Third Party company as well.

In the event of a loss of power, the facility monitoring systems will remain active.  The entire facility is equipped with a backup generator of sufficient size to maintain power to the facility for a minimum of 3 days without the supply of power from the City of Nampa.   

Five Year Accident History
ISS&D is a newly formed company in operation beginning 9/1/10, thus there have been no accidents or releases.

Emergency Response Program
In the event of release of a RMP Chemical Regulated Product, ISS&D has implemented a number of safety devices to minimize any risk to employees or the community as described in the Facility Security & Safety section of this document.  In addition, ISS&D has also established agreements with PERS as our emergency notification company, and Olympus Technical Services as well as Carl Thomas LLC for any emergency chemical response or remediation services which may be necessary.   Chlorine A & B Kits are also kept on site away from the Compressed Gas Building in the Main Building.
